summary: This document is a Claim of Lien filed by Everest Fuel Management LLC against an aircraft owned by Pumpjack Aviation LLC for unpaid services totaling $37,722.25. It outlines the details of the lien, including the aircraft's registration and serial numbers, the nature of the services provided, and the rights of the claimant under Texas law. This document appears to be an Aircraft Security Agreement detailing the obligations of the Grantor regarding the maintenance, insurance, and encumbrances related to an aircraft. It outlines the responsibilities of the Grantor to comply with FAA regulations, maintain insurance, and notify the Lender of any defaults or encumbrances affecting the aircraft. This document outlines the terms of an Aircraft Security Agreement between Pumpjack Aviation LLC and Flatiron Bank, detailing the rights and remedies of the lender in the event of default by the borrower. It includes provisions for collateral, events of default, and the responsibilities of both parties regarding legal and financial obligations. This document contains various FAA-related records concerning the registration and ownership of a Raytheon Aircraft Company model 400A, serial number RK-260, registered under the number N727KB. It includes details about the aircraft's ownership transfer to Pumpjack Aviation LLC, security agreements with Lease Finance Group, and various FAA filings and acknowledgments. The document is subject to protective orders and contains references to multiple parties involved in the aircraft's registration and financing. This document is an Aircraft Mortgage and Security Agreement between MWB Corporate Services, LLC and Wells Fargo Equipment Finance, Inc. It outlines the terms of the mortgage, including the rights and obligations of both parties regarding the aircraft, its registration, maintenance, and insurance. The agreement also details events of default and remedies available to the lender. This document is an Amended Order from the United States District Court for the Northern District of Texas regarding a case between JNV Aviation, LLC and Flight Options, LLC. The court grants the motion to release a writ of prejudgment attachment and a bond, while also detailing the properties involved and the conditions of the release. This document outlines a court order for the attachment of property belonging to Flight Options, LLC, including specific aircraft, to satisfy a financial obligation of $900,000. It includes details about the aircraft involved and the parties to the security agreement. This document contains various legal filings related to the case of JNV Aviation, LLC vs. Flight Options, LLC, including a motion for a prejudgment writ of attachment. The court granted the motion, allowing JNV to attach certain aircraft owned by Flight Options to secure a claim of $900,000. The document outlines the details of the aircraft involved and the legal basis for the attachment.

keyFacts: Everest Fuel Management LLC claims a lien for unpaid services totaling $37,722.25.
The aircraft involved is a Raytheon Aircraft Company Model 400A with registration number N727KB.
The last services were rendered on March 18, 2020.
The Aircraft Security Agreement was executed on September 10, 2019, between Pumpjack Aviation LLC and Flatirons Bank.
Moser Aviation, LLC authorized the services for which the lien is claimed.
The document outlines the responsibilities of the Grantor regarding the maintenance and insurance of the aircraft.
It specifies that all inspections and maintenance must be performed by FAA-authorized personnel.
The Grantor must notify the Lender of any loss or damage to the aircraft and maintain comprehensive insurance.
The Grantor is prohibited from removing any parts from the aircraft without replacing them with comparable items.
The document includes provisions for default and the consequences of failing to meet the obligations outlined.
The agreement outlines the rights of the lender in case of default by the borrower.
Pumpjack Aviation LLC is the grantor and is responsible for the indebtedness outlined in the agreement.
Flatiron Bank is the lender providing the loan secured by the aircraft.
The agreement includes provisions for the appointment of a receiver in case of default.
Martin J. Our is the manager of Pumpjack Aviation LLC and signed the agreement on behalf of the company.
The aircraft in question is a Raytheon Aircraft Company model 400A with serial number RK-260 and registration number N727KB.
Pumpjack Aviation LLC is identified as the registered owner of the aircraft.
Minnesota Bank & Trust released its security interest in the aircraft on September 10, 2019.
The document includes multiple references to FAA regulations and requirements for aircraft registration.
There are several signatures from individuals in managerial positions related to the aircraft's ownership and registration.
The Aircraft Mortgage and Security Agreement was executed on December 27, 2012.
The aircraft involved is a Raytheon Aircraft Company model 400A with serial number RK-260.
Wells Fargo Equipment Finance, Inc. is the lender in this agreement.
MWB Corporate Services, LLC is the mortgagor in this agreement.
The agreement includes provisions for events of default and remedies available to the lender.
The court granted the Amended Joint Motion to Release Writ of Prejudgment Attachment.
A bond of $5,000 was released to JNV Aviation, LLC as part of the court's order.
The original writ of attachment was issued on April 7, 2010, by the Texas Court.
Flight Options, LLC is required to maintain a surety bond of $910,000.00.
The document includes details about various aircraft involved in the case.
A court ordered the attachment of property belonging to Flight Options, LLC to satisfy a financial obligation of $900,000.
The aircraft involved in the attachment includes multiple tail numbers.
Michael Rossi signed the Aircraft Security Agreement as CFO of Flight Options, LLC.
Bret Wiener signed a release as Vice President of FO Financing LLC.
The security agreement was executed on November 30, 2010.
JNV Aviation, LLC is seeking $900,000 from Flight Options, LLC for breach of contract and fraudulent inducement.
The court found that Flight Options is justly indebted to JNV Aviation, LLC.
The attachment includes multiple aircraft owned by Flight Options, LLC.
Donald R. Fitzgibbons provided an affidavit supporting JNV's claims.
Leonard B. Rose and Colton P. Johnson are attorneys representing JNV Aviation, LLC.
